climbs.name: Alberta Tango
climbs.fa: FA and Prep Konstantin Stoletov, July 2020

content.description:
Start 5m right of " Son of a Mitch", see beta photo. Climb on easy ground past two bolts. Take a breath and get into a restless sequence of high steps, shallow pockets and looking for hidden footholds. Do a " tango" move and get onto a hopeless slab where you may find a "Thanks God" jug or take a whip. Traverse up and left on an easy ground toward  "Son of a Mitch" belay station.
Named after Albert Martino.

7 bolts, bot #3 is a fixed draw

Boulder V8 but run out of the gas after 10 moves? Little Russia got this one for you! Start right of the small overhanging bulge. Climb up and left on an easy ramp till you reach two five moves V2 bouldering problems in a row. Pull trough them and step high on a small face traversing to the belay station. Make sure that your belayer is clipped to the belay bolt and not getting pulled off in the case you fall!
Named after Brent Bach.

Just right of the small overhanging wall, 5m deeper in the canyon after the Tryangle.
6 bolts

Start at the left side of the canyon just before via ferrata. Step up, clip the first bolt and get into very physical sequence of side pulls, laybacks and feet smears. Depending on how many pull ups you can do it may feel hard or very hard:)

Pay attention at the 3rd bolt. You can clip it from very good holds on your left without risking to deck!

Babay is a hairy, scary creature that leaves in the dark corner and gets out if kids don't behave....behave well and you will send!



Very end of the canyon, just before the via ferret and first waterfall, left side.

6 bolts

Super diverse climbing. Start as Diesel but climb up and left. Pull on a powerful layback, get trough the technical overjang and if you have anything left in you unlock the fnal thin face/slab sequnce! If you can unlock this route you can unlock the DJ locker:) Stick clip the first bolt if needed. (PREP & FA K. Stoletov, Laura Castro 2019)

Named after Megan Jones

7 bolts

Pumpy. Start left of small cave. Climb on easy face, trending left. Clip the 2nd bolt and engage into never ending pumfest.
Named after Tim "Diesel"Jewison.

This route is located ~100m deeper in the canyon from the Tryangle. Left side. Look for the wall with a small cave at the base.
7 bolts

Start under a small overhang just left of the "Davy Jones locker". Go on a face and pull trough laybacks, high steps and thin face moves till you reach an obvious overhang. Go for a big move and try not to peel off! Finish with a few more balance moves. Must do for 11a grade in the canyon! Third bolt has a chain permadraw on it for an easy clip. Named after Amy Blais.

Just left of the "Davy Jones locker", 11c, start under a small overhang.
9 bolts, 3rd bolt is a chain permadraw.

Technical. Start right of small cave. Climb on slabby face, trending left. Clip the 3nd bolt and climb past powerfull underclings and deadpoints past the tricky overhang. Pull trough the final mantel if you still have something left in you!
Named after Matt Albert.

Start right of the small cave.
7 bolts

Do a few moves on an easy ground and mantel on a big ledge (no hands rest). Climb a cool yellowish face with some great moves, clip a 1st fixed draw and step left onto a small stance under a roof. The apparent “death block” that is on your left was crowbarred, hammered, and molested in any way possible by route builders and pronounced solid. Step on it.  Clip a second fixed draw (you may want to extend it) and pull a technical and powerful roof to the thin face moves. Climb the face and if you are still hanging there clip the belay station:)! Named after David “Rad Dave” Bassett who spent days and days excavating this wall.



Back of the canyon, left wall just before the via ferret steps. Start just left of a pile of yellowish rocks that were one day hanging on the wall. One can only admire the amount of work that was put into these climbs by the route builders.

10 bolts

Climb up and left past two bolts reaching a good sloppy ledge (no hands rest). Look up, think, and get into continuous ever thinning moves around the seemingly impassable holdless bulge (crux). Pass the impassable bulge and continue on an easier ground till the second big ledge with another no hands rest. If you short enough you may end up doing a cool “fall onto a jug” move as was done on FA. Continue along the edge into the final corner under a small roof. Pull the roof on the jugs to the chain belay station. The FA could be done one week earlier but one of the climbers was missing his little child and left for home….here is the name.



Start 2m right of the “Rad Dave” under a small overhang. Just before the via ferrata steps.

10 bolts

climbs.name: Son of a Mitch
climbs.fa: Prep and FA Konstantin Stoletov, June 2020

content.description:
Walk along the left side of the canyon almost till the waterfalls. Start atop of the little hill straight into boldly, pumpy moves. Look around at the third bolt...holds are good but not obvious. Clip it, pull the overhang  and get on the tricky face. Finish it going straight or right, same difficulty.  

Use clip in bolt for belayer...so he/she won't be pulled off in case of a fall.

See beta foto for the topo.

Named after Mitchell Canham.


5 bolts

A collection of moderate routes on generally solid rock. Mostly vertical, techy climbing. 

This sector sees effectively no sun. Sometimes puffs of warm air come down the canyon (interspersed with very cold air of course).
